reviews.review_msg: Michele was actually a really great prof! She's caring, her office hours and very helpful and make sure to bring your assignments to her to read over. However, she is a tough grader, she doesn't give out anything above a B+ easily, so you must work hard in this course to get the grade you want.

Read your theory from the text and read your feedback on your assignments.  Gives you a great framework of theory to apply to your assignments.  Michele is also very postitive, dynamic, has personality galore and cloaks her intellectual abilities with a nuturing teaching style.

Overall she is a decent prof who tries to engage students and is very into her teaching as well. However, she is a tough marker and don't always provide help even when it is promised (my half-hour appointment was made into 5 and no extra office hour was provided). Show up to class and read and follow the textbook. Long lectures.

She is an extremely hard marker, don't expect an A in her class, if you can scrap by with a B, consider yourself lucky. You forfeit your participation grade if you skip class twice. Giltrow worshipper, she has an unhealthy obsession with her, my biggest mistake was taking this class in my first year do not take it unless ABSOLUTELY necessary.

She isn't very organized but tries to be helpful by answering any questions. She loves the textbook's author so you have to write according to the textbook guidelines to get good marks. This course has some potential to improve your writing but I do not recommend taking this class with her.

Extremelly hard marker, way too many assignments, very vague and unhelpful. My friend who missed a class was not able to receive ANY of the missing handouts and the prof wasn't able to make extra time for her to give her extra help. Very disorganized and doesnt reply to important emails. Class is way too long (3 hrs) and could be condensed to 1 hr

She changed my perception on writing entirely. I learnt the importance of understanding the rationale of the writing styles behind each medium and how to integrate them to gain the trust of the reader. This was why she didn't give specific guidelines. She wanted us to develop the sensitivity to adjust our writing style in accordance to the context.

Funny/nice. Helpful too, b/c she will take a look at your assignments before they are due if you ask. Way too many assignments, especially towards the end of the course! If you are already with a heavy course load and are struggling to juggle assignments this course will break your back. Teaches more about concepts, features of academic writing.

He's a fun professor but he's also very vague about what the criteria are for the assignments so there's a lot of questions and he has a tendency to answer questions with, "you should know that by now." Yeah, that definitely wasn't embarrassing :/ He's pretty chill and gives good feedback tho.

Worst prof at SFU , horrible horrible horrible horrible , He does not know what he is doing. He does not give you a clear outline or expectations on what he wants. He'll just vaguely say and mark you in comparison of what others have provided. If you're work is better overall to your classmates. He doesn't teach anything. Worst Prof Ever

English is my second language and I was nervous about taking this class.  Scott was highly involved in our online class and provided exceptionally clear and helpful feedback.  I left the class feeling empowered, with new tools to lead the way for many papers to come in university.
